intro: Falcatifolium sleumeri, commonly known as the Sikkim arrowhead, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Falcatifolium sleumeri is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes.
